quotes: While campaigning on 30 July 2004, Aziz survived an assassination attempt in the Attock District of Punjab, Pakistan.

Following the resignation of Mir Zafarullah Khan Jamali on 26 June 2004, Hussain nominated Aziz for the office of prime minister and was also a top choice for the candidacy of prime ministerial post by Musharraf.
By 2004, Aziz had become a right hand of general Musharraf, as Musharraf described in his memoirs.

organizations.name: Supreme Court of Pakistan
quotes: His public and liberalisation of economy policy expanded the political role of Supreme Court of Pakistan in a higher level of the government and to target high-level of government corruption independently without government interferences.

organizations.name: IMF
quotes: Pakistan's fiscal performance was praised by IMF and the World Bank.

organizations.name: World Bank
quotes: Pakistan's fiscal performance was praised by IMF and the World Bank.
The World Bank further reiterated that Pakistan's economic growth bolstered international confidence.

organizations.name: Al-Qaeda
quotes: Ten suspected Al-Qaeda perpetrators were arrested in Egypt and later extradited to Pakistan for the crime.

organizations.name: National Assembly
quotes: However, Aziz was not a member of the National Assembly, although he was a Senator.
As required by the constitution, the prime minister had to be a member of the National Assembly.

quotes: The strong oligarch business class of Pakistan, notably Chaudhry Shujaat Hussain, had been impressed by Shaukat Aziz's performance as finance minister.

roles.title: Senator
quotes: However, Aziz was not a member of the National Assembly, although he was a Senator.
While campaigning on 30 July 2004, Aziz survived an assassination attempt in the Attock District of Punjab, Pakistan.
While campaigning on 30 July 2004, Aziz survived an assassination attempt in the Attock District of Punjab, Pakistan.
The suicide bomb attack was staged in Fateh Jang, a small town to the north of the capital, Islamabad, where Aziz was contesting an election.
The suicide bomb attack was staged in Fateh Jang, a small town to the north of the capital, Islamabad, where Aziz was contesting an election.
After safely reaching Islamabad, Aziz instigated a probe, while the foreign office contacted its mission in Egypt to try to determine the veracity of an Al Qaeda claim of responsibility.
After safely reaching Islamabad, Aziz instigated a probe, while the foreign office contacted its mission in Egypt to try to determine the veracity of an Al Qaeda claim of responsibility.
Ten suspected Al-Qaeda perpetrators were arrested in Egypt and later extradited to Pakistan for the crime.
